  • java.lang.Object

      • getStartingWindow

        @Nullable
public W getStartingWindow()
        Description copied from interface: WindowManager
        Finds the Window that should be displayed during the Ready phase of an application.

        The WindowManager expects a configuration flag windowManager.startingWindow to be present in order to determine which Window will be displayed during the Ready phase. If no configuration is found the WindowManager will pick the first Window found in the list of managed windows.

        The configuration flag accepts two value types:

        • a String that defines the name of the Window. You must make sure the Window has a matching name property.
        • a Number that defines the index of the Window in the list of managed windows.
        Specified by:
        getStartingWindow in interface WindowManager<W>
        Returns:
        a Window that matches the given criteria or null if no match is found.

      • canShutdown

        public boolean canShutdown(@Nonnull
                           GriffonApplication app)
        Description copied from interface: ShutdownHandler
        Asks this handler if the application's shutdown sequence can proceed or not.

        Return false if the shutdown sequence must be aborted.

        Specified by:
        canShutdown in interface ShutdownHandler
        Specified by:
        canShutdown in interface WindowManager<W>
        Parameters:
        app - the current running application
        Returns:
